sn3.9:1.2: Now on that occasion a great sacrifice had been set up for King Pasenadi of Kosala. Five hundred bulls, five hundred bullocks, five hundred heifers, five hundred goats, and five hundred rams had been led to the pillar for the sacrifice.
sn3.9:1.3: And his slaves, servants, and workers, spurred on by punishment and fear, were busy making the preparations, wailing with tearful faces.
sn3.9:2.1: Then, in the morning, a number of bhikkhus dressed and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn3.9:2.2: When they had walked for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from their alms round, after the meal they approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said:
sn3.9:2.3: “Here, venerable sir, a great sacrifice has been set up for King Pasenadi of Kosala. Five hundred bulls . . . have been led to the pillar for the sacrifice.
sn3.9:2.4: And his slaves servants, and workers, spurred on by punishment and fear, are busy making preparations, wailing with tearful faces. ”
sn3.9:3.1: Then the Blessed One, having understood the meaning of this, on that occasion recited these verses:
sn3.9:4.3: These great sacrifices, fraught with violence,
sn3.9:5.3: They do not attend that sacrifice:
sn3.9:5.4: The great seers of right conduct.
sn3.9:6.2: Are always offered by family custom,
sn3.9:6.3: Where no goats, sheep, or cattle
sn3.9:6.5: They attend a sacrifice like this:
sn3.9:6.6: The great seers of right conduct.
sn3.9:7.3: For one who makes such sacrifice
sn3.9:7.4: It is indeed better, never worse.
sn3.9:7.5: Such a sacrifice is truly vast
sn3.9:7.6: And the devatās too are pleased. ”
